strong.span: We are accepting applications for the 2020 Summer Enrichment Program

span.br: Click here for information and the Application | Submit questions through Let's Talk

strong.style: color: rgb(0, 32, 96); font-family: Verdana; font-size: large;
strong.span: SCSD schools are closed through May 15.

strong.style: color: rgb(0, 32, 96); font-family: Verdana; font-size: large;

p.span: On April 16, Governor Cuomo announced schools will remain closed through through May 15. Online instruction will continue. Breakfast & lunch will continue to be provided.

span.span:
APRIL 10: Letter to Families | Spanish | French | Pashto | Arabic | Urdu
APRIL 09 UPDATE: Change to Breakfast & Lunch Delivery Schedule
APRIL 08 UPDATE: June Regents Exams Cancelled and More
APRIL 01 UPDATE:

a.title: April 1 Update
a.span: Continuity of Instruction; Spring Break Removed From Calendar

span.style: font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);
font-family: Verdana, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 13px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51);
span.span: Due to the impact of COVID-19 on the state, schools are not receiving any increase in Foundation Aid. As a result, SCSD is looking at a $4.6 million budget deficit. We need your help. Please share your thoughts on we can operate more efficiently and/or what you think we should eliminate to help balance the budget.
The thoughtexchange is open through April 21.

span.style: font-size: 20px; text-decoration: underline; font-family: Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, Helvetica; color: rgb(102, 102, 102);

a.title: Check out this story in the Daily Gazette on April 15

img.alt: Check out this story in the Daily Gazette on April 15

div.div: Check out this story in the Daily Gazette on April 15
Chelsea Izzo, a 4th grade teacher at Yates, surprised her students with a special delivery to each of their homes. The story was in the Daily Gazette on April 15. Click here.
VIEW MORE About Check out this story in the Daily Gazette on April 15

a.title: Smart Schools Investment Plan is Posted for Review

img.alt: Smart Schools Investment Plan is Posted for Review

div.div: Smart Schools Investment Plan is Posted for Review
We have an opportunity to request Smart Schools Bond Act funding for emergency purchase of Chromebooks for our district. Click hear to see the SCSD Smart Schools Investment Plan.
VIEW MORE About Smart Schools Investment Plan is Posted for Review

a.title: Take a peek at Mr. Verret's online class

img.alt: Take a peek at Mr. Verret's online class

div.div: Take a peek at Mr. Verret's online class
Mont Pleasant Middle School Teacher Tom Verret gives us a peek into his virtual circle. Click here to see the video clip.

a.title: Spreading Joy and Positivity Through Chalk Messages

img.alt: Spreading Joy and Positivity Through Chalk Messages

div.div: Spreading Joy and Positivity Through Chalk Messages

SHS English Teacher Colleen Wygal created #WalkPoetry as a way to spread kindness and joy. All you need is chalk and a positive message to share. News10 did a story. Click here for the story and to learn how to share your messages.
VIEW MORE About Spreading Joy and Positivity Through Chalk Messages
Pre-K registration begins April 1. Please do not mail applications. Click here for information on how to register.
VIEW MORE About Pre-K Registration Begins April 1

a.title: Dr. Aaron Bochniak is Named Acting Superintendent

img.alt: Dr. Aaron Bochniak is Named Acting Superintendent

div.div: Dr. Aaron Bochniak is Named Acting Superintendent
The Board of Education accepted the resignation of Supt. Larry Spring Wednesday evening. Dr. Bochniak was named acting superintendent.
VIEW MORE About Dr. Aaron Bochniak is Named Acting Superintendent
Beginning March 20, breakfast and lunch delivery into our neighborhoods got underway!
VIEW MORE About Meal Delivery to Bus Stops
SAVE THE DATE: On May 7, we will observe Mental Health Awareness Month by hosting a Health Awareness Fair. Click here for more information.
VIEW MORE About SCSD Mental Health Awareness Fair
